Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizing an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption (in addition to the homestead exemption authorized under the provisions of Article VII, Section 20 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended (the "Louisiana Constitution"), which applies to the first $7,500 of the assessed valuation of property), be authorized on the next $7,500 of assessed valuation of property receiving the homestead exemption, with respect to property owned and occupied by a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of 100% by the United States Department of Veteran Affairs, and their surviving spouse, on property located in the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana, in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses shall extend and apply to property in the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 11 -- $32 Service Chg. - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 11 Proposition 
(Tax Continuation)

Summary:  $32.00, 10 year annual service charge for paying the costs of fire protection services in and for the District.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 11 of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana (the "District") continue to assess and collect an annual service charge of not to exceed Thirty-Two Dollars ($32.00) from persons owning residential or commercial structures, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District, (an estimated $10,000.00 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the assessment of the annual service charge for the entire year), for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2011 and ending the year 2020, for the purpose of paying the costs of fire protection services in and for the District, and for purposes of assessing and collecting said service charge, owners shall be assessed a service charge for each such structure which they own, each residential or commercial unit and each housing unit within a multiple dwelling structure shall be considered a separate structure and a mobile home, as defined in R.S. 9:1149.2(3)?
